intro: Senecio ruiteranii, commonly known as the Ruiter's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
